programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The chief suspect of a gangland murder gives himself up, fearing the victim's family will take revenge, and it is left to Sam to prove his innocence. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. In an episode originally broadcast live, distraught dad Jeff Clarke holds the Sun Hill stalwarts at gunpoint, prompting a desperate response from Dan Casper - who ends up getting shot, along with the real Gabriel Kent. Fortunately, Terry Perkins is able to stay cool and assume the role of mediator, helping to defuse the situation while Acting Superintendent Amanda Prosser flounders helplessly.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy confronts Lauren about her prostitution and Sicknote finds himself the unwitting accomplice in a jailbreak. Meanwhile, Skip helps a suicidal girl.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nadia does not want to be in the dark anymore and invites Cathy for a drink! Richard wants to find out what the market holders are planning.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: The Race for a Cure: Making Britain Safe - Tonight
programme.desc: Ranj Singh looks at the urgent race to find drugs to successfully treat Covid-19. With hopes of defeating the deadly virus lying with the world's scientists - including those working in Britain - Dr Singh gains first-hand access to laboratories and drug trials across the country. He reports on the unprecedented scientific efforts going into developing drugs to treat those in hospital with the virus, as well as the search for a vaccine to inoculate everyone. With the success of these trials determining how soon people can resume normal life and get the economy running as before, the stakes could not be higher.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary featuring investigations in which natural clues, including insect bites, cat hair and a rare form of bacteria helped forensic scientists solve murders.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Diane Cunningham is found murdered, the only clues are several receipts. Security footage reveals a prime suspect, but not everything is quite as it seems.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional 'hit' had taken place.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The contribution made by the FBI in tracking down drug-dealing murderer Jeffrey Matthews after the bombing of a Drug Enforcement Agency building.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team checks up on the progress of a group of bears and tigers rescued from a chicken shed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A desperate owner hopes Lisa can save a cat that has been hit by a car, and Chris battles to save Homer the turtle after a vicious dog bite.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown experiences a difficult week as he treats everything from horses, wombats, monkeys and a mother in trouble.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amy bought a gown elsewhere, before changing her mind, and now she is hunting for her dream dress, while Michelle views her outfit after losing more than three stone.
